results.title: Imperial stone: the art of Rome
results.creator_credit: Bayley Silleck, Channel Four, WNET (Television station : New York, N.Y.) and TVS
results.brief_description:
Episode number 2 of Series “Art of the western world”.
Michael Wood and Richard Brilliant look at Roman architecture which embodied the austere ideals of this conquering empire. The discovery and use of concrete and the development of architectural forms based on the keystone arch is highlighted as these had a significant effect on building design in Europe. The Panthenon is seen as a landmark structure and the transition of pagan symbols and forms into Early Christian society is discussed.

results.title: Imperial city
results.creator_credit: David Rowan, Margaret Williams and Arbor Films
results.brief_description: In 1911, the British built a new capital for India. The creation of New Delhi was the greatest artistic enterprise of the British Empire, and we follow the architects in a search for a style incorporating British and Indian architecture.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Rowan, Margaret Williams and Arbor Films

results.title: Impeachment
results.brief_description: “Summary: traces the history of impeachment from the Magna Carta through the American Revolution, the drafting of the U.S. constitution, the impeachment of Andrew Johnson and the issues involving Richard Nixon. explains the process of impeachment of a president and examines the roles of the House of Representatives and the Senate”

results.title: Impact of mining
results.creator_credit: David Roberts, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Alligator Rivers Region”.
The second film in a series looking at the work of the Supervising Scientist following the Fox Report on Uranium mining in the Kakadu National Park region of the Northern Territory. To monitor possible problems, scientific studies were carried out before work began. Shows some of the field work and by the use of interviews examines possible problems which could occur.

results.title: Imogen Cunningham, photographer
results.brief_description: A fascinating insight into the life and works of photographer Imogen Cunningham. Coming into public attention around 1910, she was celebrated in the late sixties through awards, honorary degrees and exhibitions. Her photos are looked at from three focal points: nature, portraits and figure studies.

results.title: Immunization. - 2nd ed.
results.brief_description: The external symptoms of disease, and how disease affects the blood-stream, are shown; immunity may be obtained from a disease either by contracting it and surviving, thus gaining (usually) active immunization; or by vaccination, which provides passive immunity, is just as effective, and does not endanger life. Second edition version.
